intro: Rubus × atroviridis, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, which are typically dark green and serrated. The plant produces aggregate fruits, commonly referred to as berries, which are usually dark purple to black in color. These berries are edible, though they can be quite tart and are often used in jams and pies. Rubus × atroviridis is native to various parts of Europe and is commonly found in hedgerows and woodland edges.
